{"step_by_step_thinking": "To answer this question, I need to identify which of the options is not mentioned in the documents as a method of post-coital contraception. Desogestrel is a progestin used in some forms of hormonal contraception, but it is not mentioned in any of the documents as a method of post-coital contraception. Copper-T, Levonorgestrel, and Oral Contraceptive Pills (OCPs) are all mentioned in the documents as methods of post-coital contraception.", "answer_choice": "A. Desogestrel"}
